author: MENAFN
title: United Cup: Fokina-Sorribes Pair Guide Spain To Dramatic 2-1 Win Over Brazil | MENAFN.COM
text:
( MENAFN - IANS) Perth, Dec 29 (IANS) Spain earned victory in its opening Group A tie of United Cup on Friday when Alejandro Davidovich Fokina and Sara Sorribes Tormo prevailed in the decisive mixed doubles rubber against Brazil.
With the tie locked at 1-1 after the two singles matches, Davidovich Fokina and Sorribes Tormo rallied past Beatriz Haddad Maia and Marcelo Melo 6-4, 7-5 to move Spain to 1-0 in Group A play.
Earlier, Haddad Maia prevailed in her first WTA Tour match of the new season, defeating Sara Sorribes Tormo of Spain 7-6(1), 6-2 in their Group A clash, levelling the showdown with Spain at 1-1 and sending it into a decisive mixed doubles match.
In the first match of the tie, Fokina kick-started his season with a comfortable win, where he dispatched Thiago Seyboth Wild 6-4, 6-0 to give Spain a 1-0 lead.
The 24-year-old was consistent from the baseline against the World No. 79, striking the ball cleanly off both wings to outlast the Brazilian. Fokina did not face a break point, winning 79 per cent (30/38) of his first-serve points to triumph on his United Cup debut after 87 minutes.
Each tie consists of three rubbers: one men's singles, one women's singles and one mixed doubles. There are 18 countries in the mixed-teams event, with six groups of three teams. Poland, led by Iga Swiatek, is also in Group A.
--IANS
bc/

author: archyde
title: 50% of banking and finance professionals report being targets of cybercriminals: Gentec
text:
The entry into operation of latest digital banks in Mexico has opened the talk on the degrees of safety that banking establishments can assure in opposition to the dangers of on-line fraud and hacking. In opposition to this backdrop of rising cyber threats, particularly prevalent within the banking sector, a Genetec State of Bodily Safety Report demonstrates {that a} vital 50% of banking and finance professionals reported being focused by cybercriminals in 2023, in comparison with the general fee of 31% of all industries surveyed.
Immediately it’s common for quite a few banks and monetary establishments to proceed to depend on bodily safety applied sciences that had been applied greater than a decade in the past; Whereas these options have supplied safety prior to now, their incapability to maintain up is obvious. In accordance with information from the Affiliation of Banks of Mexico and the American Chamber, within the 2021-2022 interval alone, Mexico suffered 66% of the whole cyber assaults introduced in Latin America, translating into losses of three,000 to five,000 million {dollars} yearly.
“Investing in a versatile, unified safety platform helps centralize threat mitigation methods and construct a robust cyber basis. As well as, adopting this strategy will permit them to stay agile to new wants and can open the doorways to a sequence of latest cutting-edge applied sciences, corresponding to cloud functions, enterprise analytics and options that automate and digitize out of date processes; These new options additionally assist optimize bodily safety information to acquire helpful enterprise insights,” commented José de Jesús Arellano, Vertical Gross sales Supervisor at Genetec .
When organizations start searching for a brand new bodily safety resolution, there’s a lot to think about and though banks and monetary establishments could have completely different standards of their lists of necessities, they usually prioritize a number of the identical elementary parts that result in a profitable implementation of bodily safety. Under, we discover a number of the most necessary parts to think about throughout bodily safety upgrades:
● Select open structure options on {hardware} and software program.
● Unify all video platforms, entry management and different techniques inside a single unified safety platform.
● Consolidate cybersecurity and privateness efforts utilizing a single platform.
● Prioritize automation to enhance incident response and investigative work.
● Put money into a platform with built-in capabilities that permit them to optimize information.
To stay aggressive below this enterprise context, adjust to laws and be resilient, banks and monetary establishments should modernize their strategy to bodily safety and reworking digital safety is essential to modernization in monetary establishments and banks. Transitioning to a versatile, unified safety platform helps centralize threat mitigation methods and construct a robust cyber basis

author: Tracy Hinson (KSDK)
title: St. Louis doctors seeing surge in patients with post-Christmas viruses
text:
ST. LOUIS COUNTY, Mo. — No one wants to spend their Christmas break in urgent care or emergency department waiting rooms, but that is what many St. Louisans have done.
"We are seeing three different viruses quite frequently going around,"
Mercy St. Louis Department of Medicine Chair, Dr. Farrin Manian said. "We have COVID. We have RSV, as well as, influenza. They are all cocirculating in the community right now."
Manian said people can be sick with multiple viruses at the same time and "unfortunately, many of those patients can be even more severely ill because they're trying to fight two different viruses."
He said elderly and immunocompromised patients are at greater risk of hospitalization by viruses.
There is a concern that by going to the doctor and being around others, people can get another bug.
Manian said that there is always a risk.
"You always have to look at benefits and the risks. I think the risk is still very low. If you have a reason to see a physician, that reason is usually of greater importance than the risk of getting something when you go see them," he added.
If someone is on the fence about going to see a doctor, Manian recommended the following:
- you are unable to keep anything down.
- have persistent fevers.
- are experiencing shortness of breath.
Dr. Manian also recommended wearing a mask in crowded public spaces to avoid getting sick and practicing good hand hygiene.

author: Tipranks
title: MasTec reports Q4 EPS $1.44, consensus $1.22 | Markets Insider
text:
Reports Q4 revenue $3.40B, consensus $3.32B. Jose Mas, MasTec’s ( MTZ ) Chief Executive Officer, commented, “Third and fourth quarter financial performance showed substantial improvement in 2024 giving us great momentum into 2025. By focusing on execution, we saw nice margin expansion, exceeding our expectations, and we saw almost $2 billion in backlog growth for the company during the year, a leading indicator of the strong growth opportunities ahead of us.”

author: @andaluciainf
title: Alerta naranja en Málaga y Almería y amarilla en Huelva, Córdoba, Jaén y Sevilla | Andalucía Información. Todas las noticias de Jaén
text: La Agencia Estatal de Meteorología (Aemet) ha activado este viernes el aviso naranja por calor en Málaga y Almería, así como el amarillo en las provincias de Huelva, Córdoba, Jaén y Sevilla. Tras una ola de calor de tres días de duración que ha afectado a toda Andalucía, los termómetros comienzan a dar tregua en Cádiz y Granada. Según la información de la página web de la Aemet, consultada por Europa Press, se ha activado para la jornada del viernes la alerta naranja por calor desde las 13,00 hasta las 21,00 horas en el Valle del Almanzora y Los Vélez (Almería) con máximas de 40ºC. En las zonas malagueñas de Sol y Guadalhorce y de la Axarquía las máximas serán de 39 grados, aunque en el interior de las regiones el mercurio podrá alcanzar los 40. Asimismo, durante la misma franja horaria, se ha activado el aviso amarillo por calor en la campiña cordobesa y sevillana, en Morena y Condado y en el Valle del Guadalquivir (Jaén) con máximas de 39ºC, aunque la Aemet ha destacado que localmente se podrán alcanzar los 40ºC. Además, en el Nacimiento y Campo de Tabernas de Almería la máxima será de 38ºC, mientras que en el litoral onubense se podrán alcanzar los 37ºC. Para el resto de Andalucía, se prevén cielos despejados y temperaturas en descenso generalizado, excepto en el Valle del Guadalquivir y en el litoral mediterráneo. Los vientos pasarán de carácter flojo a moderado de componente oeste, y podrán soplar con fuerza en el litoral mediterráneo. Envía tu noticia a: [participa@andaluciainformacion.es](mailto:participa@andaluciainformacion.es)
